text: Always remember that you are unique. Just like everyone else.
author: Unknown

text: If you think you are too small to be effective, you have never been in the dark with a mosquito.
author: Betty Reese

text: I find television very educational. Every time someone turns it on, I go in the other room and read a book.
author: Groucho Marx

text: People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day.
author: A. A. Milne

text: You can't have everything. Where would you put it?
author: Steven Wright

text: The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it.
author: Terry Pratchett

text: If at first you don't succeed, then skydiving definitely isn't for you.
author: Steven Wright

text: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Never put off until tomorrow what you can do the day after tomorrow.
author: Mark Twain

text: If you want your children to listen, try talking softly to someone else.
author: Ann Landers

text: By working faithfully eight hours a day you may eventually get to be boss and work twelve hours a day.
author: Robert Frost

text: The best way to appreciate your job is to imagine yourself without one.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The elevator to success is out of order. You'll have to use the stairs... one step at a time.
author: Joe Girard
